results.title: Naturally it's rubber
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, James Carr and Peter Hopkinson
results.brief_description: Tells the story of natural rubber - the rubber industry of Malaya, showing research and improvement of productivity. Shows how the rubber tree is cultivated and how the latex is collected and made into rubber on Malaysian plantations and small holdings. Also shows some of the numerous applications, from elastic yarn for swimsuits to springs for cars and how research has helped to produce many types of natural rubber compounds for different purposes.

results.title: Natural solution
results.brief_description: Shows a program of biological control which uses an imported insect to attack the introduced Water Hyacinth, a weed clogging many Australian waters.

results.title: Natural selection
results.brief_description: Discusses the impact of the theory of evolution, emphasizing the concept of nautral selection. Shows how studies by biologists carried out on moths, mosquitioes and plants provide evidence of natural selection. Reports on three experiments concerning the role of natural selection in evolution: a study in bird predation as a factor in the survival of variant species of moths at Oxford University; a study of natural selection among plant populations at Carnegie Institute; and a study of the resistance of mosquitoes to modern insecticides at the University of Western Ontario.

results.title: Natural resources of Southeast Asia
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of the natural resources of South-East Asia to the industrialised nations of the world. Explains methods of mining, use of elephants, collecting and processing of rubber, methods of agriculture, cattle raising and fishing.

results.title: Natural language learning
results.brief_description: A look at the natural language or whole language approach to the learning of language in the early years of school. This approach is based on the assumption that literacy develops naturally through the use of language as a whole, such as learning to read to follow directions, for information, and to find out about the world. This video also deals with assessment and evaluation and is a good memory jogger for teaches and consultants.

results.title: Natural childbirth at home
results.brief_description: Midwives, child-birth educators and families will find an entire Early Pregnancy Class in this wonderful video. Although it primarily addresses preparation for home-birth, all pregnant women will find it reassuring, confidence building and informative.

results.title: Natural born killers [Director's cut] [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Xtlan, New Regency Pictures, JD Productions, Jane Hamsher, Don Murphy, Clayton Townsend and Oliver Stone
results.brief_description: Oliver Stone’s unflinching macabre black comedy is possibly one of the most despairing films, a destructive romp through American popular culture witnessed through the eyes of Mickey and Mallory (Woody Harrelson and Juliette Lewis), two young serial killers. From the sit-com parody of Mallory’s sexual abuse by her father (Rodney Dangerfield) - it comes complete with laughtrack - to the apocalyptic jail riot that cements the killers’ reputations as cultural heroes, “Natural Born Killers” presents a vehement hate-letter to television and media technologies. The cast is outstanding, including Robert Downey Jr who is very funny as a sicko Australian compere of a television show that celebrates mass murder and Tommy Lee Jones as the psycho-warden of a top-security prison. “Natural Born Killers” is violent, obscene and extravagant, a rollercoaster through the media sewers of the United States. It is also a brilliant collision of filmmaking styles; with everything from music video to the avant-garde, from porn to propaganda. Features a suitably fiery soundtrack of industrial metal, punk, Arabic chants and hardcore techno. Cast also includes Robert Downey Jr., Tommy Lee Jones and Tom Sizemore.

results.title: Natsik hunting
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Peter Raymont and Mosha Michael
results.brief_description: Natsik Hunting is the story of a seal hunt. It is also the first live-action film shot and directed by an Inuk. Initial shot by 25 year-old Mosha Michael on Super 8mm and converted to 16mm by NFBC.

results.title: Native trees of Stradbroke Island: pandanus pedunculatus
results.brief_description: A aesthetic piece set to music about the Pandanus pedunculatus, a species of native tree growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland with cries of currawongs, magpies and crows in the background. No commentary.
